title: Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez play LUDO with Barcelona team-mates instead of going out partying
text:
FUN AND GAMES Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez play LUDO with Barcelona team-mates instead of going out partying 
Ivan Rakitic reveals secret lives of La Liga champions... and it's more board games than glamour BY GARY STONEHOUSE Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments THE secret behind-closed-doors lives of Barcelona’s star-studded squad have been revealed – and it’s more fun and games than glitz and glamour. 
Icons such as Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez love nothing more than to get involved with a spot of Ludo during away trips, according to team-mate Ivan Rakitic. EPA 4 The Barcelona squad love nothing more than getting together for a game of Ludo, says Ivan Rakitic 
The La Liga champions, managed by Luis Enrique, may boast some of the planet’s greatest and wealthiest players, but it appears it is the simple things that keep the magic ticking over and the harmony among the group strong away from the pitch. 
Keep up to date with ALL the BARCELONA news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And the competitive nature within the Nou Camp set-up means that the Barca boys often spend hours in each other’s company, instead of retreating to their bedrooms. 
Croatian international Rakitic told Novi list : “When we travel, we always play Ludo and joke with each other afterwards. related articles Newcastle midfielder Cheick Tiote joins Chinese second division side Beijing Enterprises on two-year deal time to change Arsenal should ditch Mesut Ozil, get tough with Arsene Wenger and behave like a big club Not so hot, Rod See the moment Jese Rodriguez misses a three-yard sitter on debut for Las Palmas in Granada defeat Yaw a Star Porto in talks with Manchester City over a loan deal with an option to buy for youngster Yaw Yeboah Barca to gazump United Barca are to go head-to-head with Manchester United for Benfica duo Lindelof and Semedo 
“Pepe Costa, Messi , Suarez and [Javier] Mascherano are in one team, [Andres] Iniesta, [Sergio] Busquets, [Jordi] Alba and me are a second team. 
“It started during [Pep] Guardiola’s last season, it is fun, better than putting your earphones on and isolating from friends on a bus or plane. 
“Recently we travelled to Qatar and spent six hours playing that game!” Reuters The likes of Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez shun the party life, instead preferring to get together for a board game Getty Images Croatian star Ivan Rakitic has been at Barcelona since 2014 and made over 100 appearances for the Spanish giants Getty Images 4 Rakitic revealed that it was Pep Guardiola that first introduced Ludo to the Barca squad during his final season in charge 
And despite the reputation some footballers are labelled with, Rakitic insists he and his team-mates often shun the glamorous party opportunities presented to them for a more quiet, family life. 
The 28-year-old added: “I know people think a footballer’s life is all glamour, crazy parties… but recently Suarez invited me to his 30th birthday, and it was the same as if any of you invited me: we bought him presents, sat down, had a dinner, conversation, had some fun and that is it. 
“The majority of players at Barca, including Messi, Suarez and me, are family people and avoid parties and bars.” Barcelona's Luis Suarez and Neymar have training ground 'row'
